profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 15:50:30 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, sketches, a journal, biographical information, printed materials, and photographs of George Parton, and his artist sons Arthur, Ernest, and Henry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 723: Biographical material, correspondence, and sketches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3894: Henry Woodbridge Parton's journal of a sketching trip to the White Mountains, N.H. with Arthur and Ernest Parton, 1871; correspondence; 22 sketches, undated and 1866-1877, 5 signed by Ernest Parton; biographical material; clippings and magazine articles; and two photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED: Photocopy of the section of the Parton family biography written by Charles Parton; and award certificates from the Universal Exposition, Paris, to Arthur Parton, 1895, Ernest Parton, 1895 and 1900, and from the World's Columbian Exposition to Ernest, 1893.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 723 and 3894 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel 723: Originals returned to the lender, Sonia Parton Whelan, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: George and Elizabeth Parton, Hudson, N.Y., parents of artists Arthur, Ernest, and Henry; associated with the Hudson River School of painting.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reel 723 lent for microfilming by Sonia Parton Whelan, 1974. Material on reel 3894 and unmicrofilmed Parton family biography were donated 1981 and 1988 by Charles Parton. The award certificates were donated 1992 by Anna W. Saxton. Whelan, Parton and Saxton are the grandchildren of Arthur Parton.

controlaccess.subject: Landscape painting
Marine painting
Hudson River school of landscape painting
controlaccess.geogname: White Mountains (N.H. and Me.) -- Description and Travel
